columns.text: In this problem, we will determine the target stock price of the company based on their expected price-to-earnings ratio.

Before we solve this, we must first list down the given values that will be relevant to the solution.


| Equity|$6,800,000 | 
|--|--| 
| Net Income|$815,000| 
|Dividends |$285,000 | 
| Number of Shares|245,000 | 
| Price-to-Earnings Ratio|16 |

Now, we can solve for the income of the company next year by multiplying the current income by $1$ plus the sustainable growth rate.

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Income Next Year}&=\$815,000 \times (1+0.08453)\\
&=\$883,891.95
\end{aligned}$$

The income of the company next year based on the growth rate is $\$883,891.95$.

Finally, we can go back to the formula in Step 2 to get the target stock price for the year.

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Stock price}&=\text{Price-to-earnings ratio} \times\text{Earnings per share}\\[15 pt]
&=16 \times \$3.6077\\
&=\$57.7232
\end{aligned}$$

The target stock price for next year is $\$57.7232$.
